pullRequest.title: Inconsistencies in ScreenManager behavior if displayCapabilities is null & revisions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #1310
This PR is ready for review.
Risk
This PR makes minor API changes.
Testing Plan

 I have verified that I have not introduced new warnings in this PR (or explain why below)
 I have run the unit tests with this PR
 I have tested this PR against Core and verified behavior (if applicable, if not applicable, explain why below).
 I have tested Android, Java SE, and Java EE

Unit Tests
[Describe the unit tests and behaviors added in this PR]
Core Tests
Tested using manticore
Summary
Fixed issue in TextAndGraphicsManager relating to WindowCapability,
WindowCapability is never null, when we switched from DisplayCapability to using WindowCapability,
we were checking for if DisplayCapability is null. Now we need to check if a certain capability within WindowCapability is null.
There were a couple of spots in TextAndGraphiicsManager that weren't changed.
CLA

 I have signed the CLA

commit.message: Fixed WindowCapability logic in BaseText and graphic manager

Added three methods to WindowCapability  to be used in managers of the ScreenManager

hasImageFieldOfName,  hasTextFieldOfName, getMaxNumberOfMainFieldLines
Aligned how java uses WindowCapability  in TextAndGraphicManager  with IOS
Updated MenuManager handling of WindowCapability to align with IOS
Added ManagerUtility to extend capabilities of WindowCapability, Removed added methods from WindowCapability and added them to ManagerUtility.WindowCapabilityUtility
Deprecated hasTextFieldOfName and hasImageFieldOfName, changed where they were used to use ManagerUtility.WindowCapability methods
Changed logic to use new Class and methods in ManagerUtility.WindowCapabilityUtility
Moved ManagerUtility class and created symlink
Removed Method that was added by mistake
Moved this class to base managers
Added check back that checks if capability is null
Removed old test that get covered in newly added test testShouldSendText
Update getMaxNumberOfMainFieldLines to align with iOS
Update T&G manager capability handling to align with iOS
Remove some duplicate code from TextAndGraphicManager
Simplify some helper methods in screen manager

nodes.bodyText: Does it max sense to just alter the utility method call to return 4 by default instead of this long inline if statement? This is not a hard requirement and would be interested to know how iOS handles it.

I don't believe this logic is correct. Based on the RPC spec, the imageField array is not mandatory. Therefore if it is not included, we should infer that it is not supported, right? @joeljfischer can you confirm?
Is there a reason why this methods are shouldSend____Text instead of something more like is___TextSupported?
Same question before around if the imageField array is null. @joeljfischer for visibility.
